title: Students hack their way into the future of brain-computer interfaces
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Technology At a hackathon over the weekend, students worked with real brain data to create new tools for brain-machine systems.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.

Inside a quiet office building usually reserved for professional engineers, the clicking of keyboards and low murmurs of debate filled the air, as students crowded around screens displaying brain signals instead of spreadsheets.

title: Martha Stewart is opening her first East Coast restaurant at Foxwoods
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel Guests can sip a 'Martha-tini' or a frozen pomegranate 'Martha-rita.
' A rendering of The Bedford by Martha Stewart at Foxwoods Resort Casino.
The Bedford by Martha Stewart Guests at Foxwoods Resort Casino in Connecticut will soon dine like they’re at a dinner party at Martha Stewart’s estate.

title: She’s running Boston on her dad’s birthday — for two lives lost
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Boston Marathon Michelle Merrill is running the 2026 Boston Marathon with Tedy’s Team in memory of her father and brother, raising money for stroke and heart disease patients.
Michelle Merrill is running the 2026 Boston Marathon.
In our “Why I’m Running” series, Boston Marathon athletes share what’s inspiring them to make the 26.

title: Winter storm triggers Commuter Rail cancellations, delays across Greater Boston
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Transportation Ongoing storm impacts caused widespread disruptions on the MBTA.

John Blanding/Globe photo, file Weather: Delays and service disruptions rippled across Greater Boston’s transit network Tuesday as the region continued to dig out from nearly 2 feet of snow over the previous two days.
Multiple Commuter Rail lines experienced delays and cancellations due to ongoing winter storm impacts, according to a statement from MBTA Manager of Media Relations and Public Affairs Jake O’Neill.

title: Final town-by-town snow totals: See who hit the jackpot for Mass.

title: ‘Go to God, baby’: Lindsay Clancy files malpractice lawsuit, says she heard a voice ordering her to kill her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Clancy alleges her medical providers misdiagnosed her bipolar disorder and prescribed a bevy of medications that led to her psychotic break.
Lindsay Clancy appeared via Zoom from Tewksbury Hospital for a hearing in Plymouth Superior Court in Brockton.
Clancy has pleaded not guilty to three counts of murder for the slayings of her three young children.
